judgment_metrics.rationale: Core strike quality indicator; directly reflects center contact
Energy transfer efficiency; correlates with smash but adds speed context
Critical for trajectory control and consistency; low spin indicates poor contact or delofting
Adequate descent required for predictable landing; shallow descent indicates launch or spin issues

diagnostic_metrics.rationale: Used for gapping validation and trend monitoring; not grade-driving because distance control intent varies
Informational for trajectory assessment; not grade-driving because acceptable range is wide

excluded_metrics.rationale: Speed is outcome, not strike quality; can vary intentionally
Swing characteristic, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope
Directional control, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope
Swing characteristic, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope

c_definition: C-shot indicates poor contact quality: thin/fat strike (low smash), insufficient spin for trajectory control, or shallow descent angle. These shots lack the consistency required for approach play.
notes: Mid irons balance distance and control. All four judgment metrics remain critical. Spin thresholds will be lower than short irons but still judgmental. This is the validated baseline class (7i).
